comment:
We spent 30 mins of class today talking about a presentation that he decided "we are not doing." (So, a waste of everyone's time).

Then, he asked 4 students about their religions and their perception of god. (Waste of time and illegal?)

Have not had to take a test of his yet, but I sure don't feel prepared because he hasn't taught anything.

"Outline" for exams barely use any info on exams... frustrating dissonance between what he tells you to study, and what is on the actual tests. Makes you do too many things per week, incentivizing you to put your brain on autopilot, without actually learning anything. Reuses covid-era lectures, but all of the exam content content is from the book..

Quite chill most of the time and the course is pretty easy like Friday quizzes and only 2 tests. The only problem I had was just the essays. Just hope you have a good group if not he can be understanding of that and another problem is that he wants specific things onto a paper which can be very confusing unless your like great on writing papers.

Overall funny/interesting guy that made 9AM class tolerable. There are 2 tests, 2 papers (one a group project), and only a couple homework assignments so aim to do well. The textbook is optional but is helpful since he sometimes unfortunately gets sidetracked in lectures and doesn't always finish. Also tough grader with papers but he teaches well.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: As time goes on you realize how wired this guy is. He says very questionable comments toward students and sometimes he goes too far. He was talking about prostitution, and how I would think it's liberating for a women. He then goes on to talk about only fans but then says to me, "I'm not saying you should do it." Made me feel very uncomfortable!

I'm not sure this guy ever took a writing class in his life. Good luck if you have him, genuinely my least favorite professor I've ever taken, expect mild racism in class and useless lectures, essays are graded super harsh.

Professor Dyer is great! His grading criteria was clear and he always provided really helpful feedback when needed. I took this course online and felt like the weekly modules were manageable as the last 7 discussions get dropped and you don't have to complete them. There is one group essay at the end, but it is not that taxing. I loved his class!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Dyer was truly the best professor I have had to date.  He takes the time to get to know you and he truly cares about his students. You can tell he enjoys teaching and being around younger people. Hes great for survey courses because he makes the information relatable to everyone. Just work hard thats it.

Dr. Dyer will easily go down as my favorite professor I had in college. The course is one easy quiz each week, one paper, and one group project, which he gives so much time to complete. If you attend class, this should be an easy A for you. I would take him for all my classes if I could. Made 9 AM classes feel well worth waking up for.

Do NOT take this class. Professor spends the whole class like it's a comedy show instead of teaching, then throws quizzes and tests like he's actually taught the material. Study guides were abysmal and completely unhelpful. Five absences and you get an F for participation, which is 15% of your grade. He will report you after missing a two classes.

Professor Dyer is great! He truly cares about you and knows all of his students. Makes class fun, you will always feel good in his class. Weekly quizzes and a group project. Very easy class. Great professor.
Funniest professor ever!! Take him! He made waking up early for his 9 am worth it. Confused why the rating is low since the class was relatively easy. Loved starting my day with a laugh
great teacher, have weekly quizzes and two tests. have 1 essay at the end of the semester but super easy. he really is funny and cares about his students. take his class!

super funny guy and engages with students. he does take attendance and logs it as a participation grade. there are quizzes every friday and one group project with a short essay at the end of the course. there is a textbook, but he gives it to you for free with a link in the syllabus. i would take another one of his courses.

The class itself isn't hard, but it's a lot of work because the professor grades discussion posts harshly. He gives feedback that often makes no sense. Take this class only if you're willing to write full-length essays for discussion posts to get a 100. He also grades how you write replies, so make sure to be very detailed in those as well.

Took over the summer, was a lot more work than expected. Lectures were not helpful so I ended up reading 1500+ pages of my textbook to prepare for assignments. Tests are not hard but there is a lot of content. Would recommend this class, but be prepared to put a good amount of work in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Dyer knows the material very well and is excited to teach about it. He'll make it a point to get to know the students well in order to roast you efficiently and accurately, but he's a chill guy. His grading criteria is clear cut and the textbook is free but not necessary. Attend as many lectures as you can and you'll be set!

Amazing professor. Was hilarious and make himself available for students in the event that they needed help with the material. Very accommodating for life circumstances, like in the event you missed a quiz. Quiz every Friday, 2 exams, one group project, and a short essay. Extremely easy to pass.
Professor Dyer is great. I highly recommend him. Very personable, very friendly and knows what he is doing.
Great professor he cares a lot about his students. Personally I don't see how he can be difficult he is a amazing speaker and great at telling you about what you will learn in class!!!

I thoroughly enjoyed this class. There are weekly discussion posts due that were each incredibly thought provoking and interesting. In addition, there are weekly quizzes, a midterm and final, and a four page group project. I put significant work in in order to get an A in this class. There are no extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: The attendance is not grade but there is a participation grade. He does grade harshly with papers especially the oral history paper. Overall he is a funny guy though and made the class enjoyable to come to.

Genuinely my favorite professor so far, his lectures are easy to understand, and he's funny and overall just acts like a "real" person. he's encouraging and clearly very knowledgeable about the material. Participation matters more than just attendance,  cuzhe knows who you are and will remember you so youre going to have some level of discussion
Honestly was not excited to take history but this class suprised me. Professor Dyer made the class laugh and knew everyone's name so there was a real together feeling.

A great professor as he knows your name and makes conversation with you. There was 2 tests and 2 papers. One with as a group project and the other as your own. Attendance matters as it counts as your participation. Overall, easy to manage class.

Professor Dyer is the most amazing professor I had this semester. He can turn a lecture into an actual conversation with jokes. He knows everybody's name so the lectures feel more personal. Two major papers to write, and two tests but the questions are kind of random from the textbook. Come to class, it really matters!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Dyer spends a lot of class time making jokes and roasting students. Attendance matters and participation is graded. There are two papers, if you're a good writer you'll do fine on them. There are two tests. He gives a study guide, but a lot of the test questions are random and not on the study guide. He is very helpful and easy to reach.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Quizzes are pretty easy, discussions posts are kind of difficult until you fully understand what he is wanting. Tests can be hard but not too bad. For discussion posts you will need to read the textbook a lot but he also provides you with sources to get information from. Not a hard class, I recommend.

I think he's the most unique professor i've ever had. Talks to you like he's known you for years. this class isn't that hard if you just read and come to class. If you go in person, you need to go as its apart of your participation grade.

He really does have a good personality which makes lectures interesting. He knows his students names so it feels more connected. graded on very few things so you have to do well on them. Have to show up to class and participate, big chunk of grade. During lectures he speaks as if you are friends so personally that helps me remember things.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Awful teacher, harsh grader. Thinks youre cheating if you use words that are in the textbook. Stay away.

I took HIST 2112 online with Prof. Dyer and found it to be a breeze. There are discussion posts here and there and two papers. The quizzes and tests are basically the textbook. I didn't find him an overly tough grader. One paper is a group project and group projects are AWFUL. 2 of my group members never even responded to the rest of us.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Dyer was  the toughest grader I had that semester, and I know a lot of students who didn't enjoy/do well in the class because of it. However, if you are a strong writer you can do well in the class, and he was by far the most engaging and personable professor I've had so far. His lectures were relevant and interesting, and he was very funny.

Like someone else said he has an odd personality and is very engaging with the class. He literally knows who is absent and who is not and thats a first for a professor that I had. I had to withdraw just because His lectures made no sense and he is a bit of a wierdo

Professor Dyer is great! His lectures are always interesting, and he always draws useful connections. He is very easy to reach outside of class, and genuinely cares about getting to know his students. As long you are a hard-working, respectful student, the class will be a breeze!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: While the class wasn't super boring, all we did every day was go on tangents about the few slides that he had showed us. Only five grades for the entire class, one of those being a participation grade worth 20%. Two tests on very specific topics not covered in class. Two writing assignments that are graded way to hard for a history class.

Be prepared to study what he did not speak on!! Classes are pretty much filled with general discussion about the topic but it didnt really go into much detail, we rarely read out the book. Study guides were terrible! No help. If your great at reading and learning straight from the book then should have no issues. Also tough grader for history.
The class was fun and very informative ,but it was very lecture heavy and at times boring.

While this class was fun and enjoyable in class, it was more challenging behind the scenes. You are graded by 2 tests where 2 long answers are worth 40 points of your grade. You also have 2 essays, one by yourself and one as a group. Then your only other grade is participation. If you want to earn A's on any of the assignments buckle up.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Emphasis on grade by few. just two tests, two papers, and participation. Thisll likely be my only B despite trying & I know a few people with Cs. Participation doesnt have a rubric & those who talk often still dont get 100s unless you know US history like the back of ur hand. He makes history interesting but gpa wise I wouldnt take it again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: First and foremost, he is not clear on whether he wants you to write an argumentative essay or informational essay. He does however grade as if he clearly explained it to you, so be careful. If you're an introvert, you'll have a difficult time in his class. He not only wants you to show up everyday, but he also wants you to speak up and argue.

Has a weird sense of humor that doesn't really make any sense and just makes him sound like a jackass to be honest haha. Only a few assignments will be graded and he grades very harshly! Wouldn't really recommend taking him haha.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: As a lecturer, he's hilarious to listen to. However, he does a great job making sure he isn't labeled as an easy grader. I dedicated, admittedly, a lot of time into my paper and I still got a B. He only has 2 papers and 2 tests for the semester which is a blessing & curse. Participation really matters so answer his questions so he knows ur voice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: He's hilarious, very direct and uses humor to strike a point across. He grades very hard, and claims it's the school's guidelines (whatever). But he is an excellent professor. Go to every class and pay attention to his lectures. Everything he says is test material. As far as written portions, good luck. I get As in English, but low Bs for him.

His grading is bull. Even if you know what you are talking about if you do not tell him in the way he wants then you get a C at best. Even his lectures are a rollercoaster, he goes on tangents that aren't even related to the lectures and you find yourself confused on what to take notes on. He clearly doesn't understand this is a prerequisite class.

Professor Dyer is a really down to earth guy, and he is a new professor. He wants you to do well, but he is a hard grader- so be prepared to do anything and everything to get the grades you want. He is super funny and I enjoy his lectures- the tests and essays are just graded really hard.
